intro: [WRONG START] Embilia pullenii, commonly known as the African star gooseberry, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and small, clustered white flowers. The plant produces bright red, berry-like fruits that are edible and have a tart flavor. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is cultivated in some regions for both horticultural and traditional uses.
